intro: Hesperis albiflora, commonly known as the white-hesperis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Hesperis albiflora is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in full sun.
